Dead by Daylight was a lot of fun in the beginning. Unfortunately the developers lost track of what they're doing.
Bugs stay in the game for quite a while (most of them will be introduced with new DLCs) and instead of fixing those bugs there'll be a shiny new costume in stores that you can buy for real money.
Apart from that the balancing isn't done according to the average player base but instead focuses on the permanent rank 20 cry babies.

Coming back to write a new update on the game since I finally had time to play the game as both the killer and survivor for quite some time now. When I first started playing the game, I gave it 4 out of 5 stars because it was a great game but filled with lots of bugs. Currently, I give it 2 out of 5 stars because you really need to play SWF until you get all meta perks that will allow you to play the game without friends.

Pros: Great game if you play Survivor with Friends(SWF) you'll have loads of fun messing with the killer. If the horror game genre is what you like, you'll enjoy the thrill and terror of hiding and running from the killer and working with others to open the exit.

Cons: DBD is only good when you play SWF simply because the game lacks communication tools with random survivors. If you are playing solo with randoms, pray the randoms bring perks and add-ons that will benefit the whole team. There is no way for you to survive alone since the game is very unbalanced where the killer is faster, stronger, and can easily gain the advantage via tunneling, camping, and killing with a mori add-on!

Finally, the game is awesome if you don't have friends to SWF. You can play as a killer since killers have access to perks that can provide all the necessary information needed to know where the survivors are and bring the game under your control. Honestly, killers are OP because the Devs see that this is the only way a killers can deal with toxic SWF who bring such perks as unbreakable, borrow-time, decisive strike, and flashlights.  Thus, it ends up ruining the game for SOLO players trying to survive alone with randoms.

Easily one of the best concepts for a multiplayer horror game I have ever seen.
